# Zillow Group (Z) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Zillow Group, Inc. operates real estate brands in mobile applications and Websites in the United States. The company offers premier agent and rentals marketplaces, new construction marketplaces, advertising, display advertising, and business technology solutions, as well as dotloop, a real estate transaction management SaaS solution. It also provides mortgage originations and the sale of mortgages, and advertising to mortgage lenders and other mortgage professionals; and title and escrow services. By 2024, Zillow and its affiliate Trulia together captured over half of the U.S. real estate website market. Zillow.com alone is the largest real estate website in the U.S., with 57.3 million monthly visitors in 2024.

The company's brand portfolio includes Zillow Premier Agent, Zillow Home Loans, Zillow Rentals, Trulia, StreetEasy, HotPads, and Out East; and a suite of marketing software and technology solutions for the real estate industry, including ShowingTime+, Spruce, and Follow Up Boss. Zillow Group, Inc. was incorporated in 2004 and is headquartered in Seattle, Washington.

## 2. Current Market Data

The current price of Z is 68.00 USD — it has decreased by −0.86% in the past 24 hours. As of today, Zillow C market cap is 15.78B. With Zillow stock trading at $65.61 per share, the total value of Zillow stock (market capitalization) is $15.88B. The 12-month stock price target is $84.75, which is an increase of 23.67% from the latest price. Z stock has fallen by −0.29% compared to the previous week, the month change is a −0.96% fall, over the last year Zillow Group, Inc. has showed a −13.35% decrease.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

### Core Business Segments
- **For Sale Revenue**: For Sale revenue was up 10% year over year to $488 million in Q3. On a trailing 12-month basis, For Sale revenue per Total Transaction Value was 10.1 basis points at the end of Q3, compared with 9.8 basis points at the end of Q3 2024.
- **Residential Revenue**: Residential revenue was up 7% year over year in Q3 to $435 million, benefiting from growth across the company's agent and software offerings and within the company's New Construction marketplace.
- **Mortgages**: Mortgages revenue increased 36% year over year to $53 million in Q3, primarily due to a 57% increase in purchase loan origination volume to $1.3 billion.
- **Rentals**: Residential increased 7% to $435 million; mortgage revenue was up 36% to $53 million; and rentals revenue climbed 41% to $174 million. Rentals revenue was up 41% year-over-year to $174 million.

### Technology Solutions
- **Zillow Showcase**: Zillow has announced that more than 50 brokerages nationwide have adopted Zillow Showcase, its premium listing marketing platform designed to help agents win more listings and sell homes faster. Showcase listings see up to 79% more views and 91% more shares, according to Zillow data.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

### Zillow Pro
Zillow today introduced Zillow ProSM, a first-of-its-kind suite of products that transforms how productive agents work by unifying the tools they need to successfully close more transactions. Once nationally available, Zillow Pro will become the primary way agents qualify for Zillow Preferred (formerly Flex), the company's performance-based partner program offering enhanced benefits and tools. Every Zillow Preferred partner agent will receive access to Zillow Pro at no additional cost through 2026 as part of their Preferred benefits.

Zillow Pro is set to launch nationally next year. Initial market launches begin in early 2026, with nationwide availability targeted for mid-year. Zillow Pro will be $138 per month for a single-seat subscription. The price for brokerages and teams will be scaled based on size.

### AI-Powered Features
AI-powered follow-up: Alerts notify agents when contacts re-engage or show signs of readiness, with AI-personalized outreach based on their contacts' search activity. Zillow today announced the launch of Virtual Staging, an AI-powered feature built directly into Zillow Showcase℠, the company's premium listing experience.

### ChatGPT Integration
Zillow has announced a partnership with OpenAI to integrate Zillow search into ChatGPT. The move makes Zillow the only real estate app available in ChatGPT, according to a press release, allowing users to explore listings, financing options and housing insights through the AI platform. In response, the Zillow app within ChatGPT will surface listings that include photos, maps and pricing — and link directly back to Zillow so potential clients can schedule tours, connect with agents or explore financing options, the release said.

### Messaging Tools
Zillow has introduced a new messaging function within its app, a feature that will allow buyers and their co-shopper the ability to chat, share listings, and stay organized throughout the journey to homeownership. Through Zillow's new messaging feature, every listing conversation stays organized in a single thread, reducing app-hopping and missed messages that can slow a buyer's momentum.

## 5. Growth Strategy

Expansion of the 'Enhanced Markets' strategy to over 35% of connections by year-end 2025. Continued development of the 'housing super app' integrating various services. Growth in the Rentals segment, targeting a billion-dollar plus revenue opportunity. Strengthening of the Mortgages segment through expanded financing programs.

Zillow aims for this segment to be a billion-dollar-plus annual rentals revenue target and a much larger business beyond that as we build our comprehensive two-sided marketplace. For full year 2025, we continue to expect to deliver mid-teens revenue growth. As an early read, we expect 2026 to have similar growth and EBITDA margin expansion as we have had the last two years.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

### Major Brokerage Partners
Zillow's Showcase enterprise partnerships include major names in residential real estate, including: Howard Hanna — the nation's largest privately held real estate brokerage — and the fifth largest brokerage in the country — offers Showcase to its agents to help them deliver stronger results for their sellers.

Partners include major brands such as Howard Hanna, Berkshire Hathaway HomeServices and The Agency. Newly named partners include The Agency, LPT Realty and Century 21 Masters in California.

### Traffic and User Base
Traffic to Zillow Group's mobile apps and sites in Q3 was up 7% year over year to 250 million average monthly unique users. Visits during Q3 were up 4% year over year to 2.5 billion.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

### Q3 2025 Performance
Q3 revenue was up 16% year over year to $676 million, above the company's outlook range. Q3 Adjusted EBITDA was $165 million, and Adjusted EBITDA margin was 24%, a more than 200-basis-point increase year over year, driven by better-than-expected revenue growth and effective cost management. Zillow also turned a profit, netting $10 million during the quarter and sustaining its run of profitability for a third consecutive quarter.

### Full Year 2024 Results
In 2024, Zillow Group's revenue was $2.24 billion, an increase of 14.96% compared to the previous year's $1.95 billion. Losses were -$112.00 million, -29.11% less than in 2023.

### Cash Position
Cash and investments at the end of Q3 were $1.4 billion, up from $1.2 billion at the end of Q2.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

### Headwinds
- **Legal Storm**: Zillow's legal challenges began ramping up in mid-June of this year when Compass filed its antitrust lawsuit against the company over its listing access standards policy. Since then another seven lawsuits have been filed with claims ranging from Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act (RESPA) violations, to copyright infringement, and job discrimination.

- **FTC Litigation**: The FTC claims the arrangement—framed publicly as a "partnership"—was in fact an unlawful anticompetitive agreement that eliminated Redfin as a meaningful competitor in the online rental space.

- **Google Competition**: Google is testing homes for-sale ads at the top of search results, edging into Zillow's turf.

- **Housing Market Volatility**: Broader housing market headwinds, including affordability issues and elevated mortgage rates, are impacting transaction volumes.

### Tailwinds
- **AI Market Growth**: The AI in real estate market projected for substantial growth from $222.65 billion in 2024 to $303.06 billion in 2025, a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 36.1%.

- **Market Leadership Position**: Zillow's strong brand and audience, coupled with ongoing innovation, position it for resilience. The company aims to drive sustainable growth by expanding its services and scaling its housing super app.

## 9. Market Shares

Zillow has market share of 43.39% in real-estate-listing-management market. The top three of Zillow's competitors in the Real Estate Listing Management category are LoopNet with 21.89%, Diverse solutions with 13.58%, Realtor.com with 10.73% market share.

Overall Real Estate Portal Visits: Zillow Group remains the most visited real estate app and website in the U.S., accounting for over 50% of all real estate portal visits, more than double its closest competitor. Over 50% of all real estate portal visits in the U.S. go to Zillow—more than double the next competitor. Market share: Over 50% of all real estate portal visits, dwarfing the competition.

### Segment-Specific Market Share
Residential revenue grew 7% year-over-year in Q3 2025 to $435 million. The Premier Agent program is a significant revenue driver, with the Flex program (performance-based) accounting for about 25% of Premier Agent revenue. Rentals: A significant growth engine, with revenue up 41% year-over-year in Q3 2025 to $174 million, driven by multifamily revenue.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

### Key Competitors
Realtor.com is one of the biggest real estate listing sites and Zillow competitors. Although it pulls data from the MLS just like Zillow, it has a reputation for better accuracy and updating listings more quickly. Redfin is both a home search site and a real estate company with its own buying and listing agents. Instead of asking friends for referrals, you can hire a Redfin agent to help you buy or sell a home directly through the platform. It's best for buyers and sellers who want lower commission fees and an easy online process.

### Competitive Advantages
The most significant difference between Zillow and professional alternatives lies in data sources and accuracy. Zillow's Zestimate algorithm, while popular with consumers, often provides inaccurate home values—especially in rapidly changing markets or areas with unique property characteristics.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

### Recent Acquisitions
Zillow Group's most recent acquisition is Virtual Staging AI, a AI-powered virtual staging app offering interiors and furnishings for real estate professionals, acquired in October 2024. Zillow Group has made 10 acquisitions across sectors such as Real Estate IT, E-Commerce Enablers, Sales Force Automation and others. Virtual Staging AI, Follow Up Boss and Spruce are its latest acquisitions.

### Strategic Partnerships
Clarification was provided that the Redfin partnership did not involve a transfer of contracts but rather a syndication of listings. Zillow had to actively win this business, which demonstrates the strength of its value proposition.

### Brokerage Partnerships
Zillow today announced a major milestone in the expansion of its flagship listing marketing experience, Zillow Showcase℠: more than 50 agreements signed with brokerages and franchisors since the product launched in 2023.

## 12. Recent Developments

### Q3 2025 Earnings (October 30, 2025)
Zillow delivered Q3 revenue of $676M, up 16% YoY, exceeding the high end of guidance. EBITDA rose to $165M with 24% margin, expanding over 200bps YoY. Rentals revenue surged 41%, while for-sale outperformed the market with 10% growth.

### Product Launches
- **Zillow Pro announced** (October 15, 2025): Zillow Pro is set to launch nationally next year. Zillow will open an early-access interest list for agents attending its annual Unlock conference in Las Vegas November 3-5. Initial market launches begin in early 2026, with nationwide availability targeted for mid-year.

- **Virtual Staging Launch** (September 10, 2025): Virtual Staging is the first major integration of technology from Virtual Staging AI (VSAI), first introduced through Zillow's October 2024 acquisition of that company.

### Legal Developments
On the Wednesday before the Thanksgiving holiday, U.S. District Court Judge Anthony Trenga granted a motion to consolidate the lawsuit brought by the Federal Trade Commission with a related case from attorneys general in Arizona, Connecticut, New York, Virginia and Washington state. The FTC filed a lawsuit against Zillow and Redfin on Sept. 30 in the Eastern District of Virginia, alleging the two companies conspired to eliminate competition in the rental listings market in violation of federal antitrust laws.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

Based on the comprehensive analysis of Zillow Group's current position, growth prospects, and market dynamics:

### Buy Rating: **7.2/10**

**Rationale:**
- Strong revenue growth momentum with Q3 2025 showing 16% YoY growth exceeding guidance
- Dominant market position with over 50% market share in real estate portal visits
- Successful transition to profitability with three consecutive profitable quarters
- Strategic AI initiatives positioning the company for future growth
- Diversified revenue streams reducing dependency on any single business segment

**Risk Factors:**
- Significant legal headwinds with multiple ongoing lawsuits
- High valuation metrics suggesting limited upside at current levels
- Regulatory scrutiny from FTC and state attorneys general
- Competitive pressure from Google's entry into homes-for-sale advertising

### Estimated Fair Value: **$78-82**

The fair value assessment considers:
- The 12-month stock price target is $84.75, which is an increase of 23.67% from the latest price.
- Strong fundamental performance with positive EBITDA margins and growing cash position
- Market-leading position in a growing digital real estate market
- AI-driven product innovation providing competitive moats
- Balanced against legal risks and competitive pressures

This represents approximately 15-20% upside from current levels, making it suitable for growth-oriented portfolios with moderate risk tolerance.
tldr_summary:
Zillow Group is a leading digital real estate marketplace providing property listings, agent services, mortgage originations, and technology solutions for real estate professionals and consumers. The company dominates the U.S. real estate website market with over 50% market share, capturing 250 million monthly unique users across its platforms including Zillow, Trulia, and StreetEasy.

Key investment highlights include strategic AI-powered innovations like Zillow Pro and ChatGPT integration, consistent revenue growth (16% YoY in Q3 2025), and diversified revenue streams across for-sale, rentals, and mortgage segments. The company has achieved three consecutive profitable quarters and maintains a strong cash position of $1.4 billion. Major challenges include ongoing legal disputes with the FTC and competitive pressures from emerging market entrants.

With a buy rating of 7.2/10 and an estimated fair value of $78-82, Zillow represents an attractive growth opportunity for investors comfortable with moderate technological and regulatory risks.
